solution_line_template: If the condo has {total_floors} floors and the top {penthouse_floors} floors are reserved for penthouse then there are {total_floors}-{penthouse_floors} = <<{total_floors}-{penthouse_floors}={regular_floors}>>{regular_floors} floors for regular units

If a regular floor has {units_per_regular_floor} units each, then {regular_floors} regular floors would have {units_per_regular_floor}*{regular_floors} = <<{units_per_regular_floor}*{regular_floors}={total_regular_units}>>{total_regular_units} units

If a penthouse floor has {units_per_penthouse_floor} units each, then {penthouse_floors} penthouse floors would have {units_per_penthouse_floor}*{penthouse_floors} = <<{units_per_penthouse_floor}*{penthouse_floors}={total_penthouse_units}>>{total_penthouse_units} units

The total units in the property would then be {total_regular_units} regular + {total_penthouse_units} penthouse or {total_regular_units}+{total_penthouse_units} = <<{total_regular_units}+{total_penthouse_units}={total_units}>>{total_units} units
